response_parsed.title: Containerizing Notebooks for Production using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to convert Jupyter Notebooks into production-ready web applications using FastAPI and Docker, focusing on Python 3.12+.
key_points: Create a new FastAPI application from scratch or use an existing notebook as the base.
Convert notebook cells to Python scripts and integrate them with FastAPI endpoints.
Prepare a Dockerfile for building a production-ready container image.
Install necessary dependencies and set up environment variables in the Dockerfile.
Use gunicorn or uvicorn as the WSGI server for running the FastAPI application inside the container.
Test and optimize the containerized application before deployment.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
FastAPI version 0.72.0 or higher is recommended.
Docker version 20.10.7 or higher is needed to build the container image.
caveats: Ensure that sensitive data and credentials are properly secured before deployment.
Consider implementing additional security measures such as CORS, rate limiting, and user authentication.
Optimize the containerized application for better performance and scalability.
